segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and the woman is just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not notice the puddle forming at her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he’s going to fall, and it’s going to be a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, so innocent and trusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but in here, it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and the floor is getting slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for the woman to realize what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so close to the edge, and he doesn’t even know it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
